name: 地體動力學
comment: 中階以上課程，適合大三以上學生修習，以作為探究研究所之先修課程，同時也開放碩士班無此課程基礎之學生選修。
description:
This course will present an introductory overview of plate tectonics and paleomagnetism.  It is meant for both geophysics and geology students (and anybody who wants to know a little bit more about how the earth dynamic system works).  The course stresses physical concepts and does not require an extensive background in mathematics.  The necessary math will be introduced in the lectures.  This semester the following topics will be covered:

(a) The theory of plate tectonics and the observations, principally from the oceans, that are explained by the theory.
(b) Paleomagnetism, magnetostratigraphy, reversals and sea floor magnetic anomalies.
(c) Thermal models for the oceans and continents (also some interesting problems concerning the issue of "global warming" through heat flow measurement).
(d) The application of these models to continental margins and sedimentary basin subsidence.
(e) Current concept in the tectonic scenario of Taiwan.

syllabus:
This course will present an introductory overview of plate tectonics and paleomagnetism.  It is meant for both geophysics and geology students (and anybody who wants to know a little bit more about how the earth dynamic system works).  The course stresses physical concepts and _does not_ require an extensive background in mathematics.  The necessary math will be introduced in the lectures.  This semester the following topics will be covered:

   
Part I:  
(a) The **theory of plate tectonics** and the observations, principally from the oceans, that are explained by the theory.  
(b) **Paleomagnetism**, magnetostratigraphy, reversals and sea floor magnetic anomalies.  
Part II:  
(c) **Thermal models** for the **oceans** and **continents** (also some interesting problems concerning the issue of "**global warming**" through heat flow measurement).  
Part III:  
(d) The application of these models to **continental margins** and **sedimentary basin subsidence**.  
Part IV:  
(e) Current concept in the **tectonic scenario of Taiwan**.

methodologies.note: Reading assignment: 5 papers cover: lava lake, Kelvin's estimation of Earth's age (2 papers), global warming, and plate tectonic theory

grading.note: Three to four problem sets to be completed during the semester. (Students may discuss homework, but all homework should be prepared independently.) Late homework does not exist!!!
